summary: All 256 xterm colors with their RGB equivalents, right in Vim!
name: xterm-color-table.vim
description:
GITHUB

http://github.com/guns/xterm-color-table.vim


NOTES

 * Provides command :XtermColorTable
 * Xterm numbers on the left, equivalent RGB values embedded on the right
 * Press `t` to toggle RGB text visibility
 * Press `f` while on a color to set the RGB text to that color
 * Buffer behavior similar to Scratch.vim


SCREENSHOTS

http://guns.github.com/xterm-color-table.vim/images/xterm-color-table.png
http://guns.github.com/xterm-color-table.vim/images/xterm-color-table-with-visible-rgb.png


INSPIRED BY

 * http://www.calmar.ws/vim/256-xterm-24bit-rgb-color-chart.html
 * http://vim.wikia.com/wiki/Xterm256_color_names_for_console_Vim
 * http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=664

versions.release_notes: Fix regression: GUI Vims are picky about capitalization in `hi term=NONE'
Add toggleable RGB visibility. Thanks to Alexey Radkov for the suggestion.
Removed buffer mapping; much smarter buffer behavior, Ã  la Scratch.vim
Remove `ownsyntax' statement, which is a 7.3+ feature. Thanks to Farhad Fouladi.
